fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27784].
  {panel}

Hey guys,

We really like the new task and notification features in Confluence. It really gets close to be a complete project management tool for us. But a way to log time and track it through charts and graphs would be great addition. 

Let me give some insight into how we are using it. We are a software development company, so the way we use JIRA and Confluence is much like you, I would imagine. Our developers use JIRA primarily to track their tasks and report time, etc. 

However, the non-tech side of our company (PR, Marketing, Client Services, Administrative) is currently trying to use JIRA for time tracking as well. With the new updates to Confluence, we can really move a lot of our processes (project tasks, collaboration) to Confluence, but we're still having to go to JIRA to log time and our directors have to go there to track their teams' time. 

Are their plans to allow time tracking and reporting capabilities in Confluence, making it a project "management" suite like Basecamp instead of just a collaboration tool? And if so, when?

Thanks a lot
fields.summary: Time Tracking from Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27754].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

When you copy a link to a Confluence page, as per [our instructions here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Linking+to+Pages#LinkingtoPages-Copyingandpastingalinkfromyourwebbrowser], the link is created as a web URL link, rather than a normal space/page link. The result of this is:

# If you go to the linked page's info, that link is not listed as incoming
# If the page linked is ever renamed, then that link will not be automatically changed to the new location

This also happens if you are copying and pasting images that are stored as attachments in Confluence. In [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/OganDg], it's mentioned that you can drag and drop images into the editor, which is the same as copy and paste.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Follow the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Linking+to+Pages#LinkingtoPages-Copyingandpastingalinkfromyourwebbrowser] to copy and paste a link into a page
# Click on the link, and then click Edit, to find that it's a web URL link

h4. Workaround

Instead of copying and pasting the link, create the link manually.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting a link to a Confluence page results in a web URL link instead of a space/page link

Customers want the ability to:
 * Remove old versions of pages older than specific date (e.g. get rid of anything older than 6 months)
 * Limit or Increase the number of old versions kept (e.g. limit to 5 previous versions)

 * Reduce the database usage of Confluence, particularly on frequently- or automatically-updated pages
 * Comply with legislative document destruction requirements (e.g. delete content older than some years).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27666].
  {panel}

This issue strongly affected the Confluence Enterprise Hosted Migrator work. Here is how to reproduce the issue.

# Create a plugin and a component in tha plugin. 
# Create a webwork action.
# Attempt to setter inject the component into the webwork action.
# Attempt to run something that is not the execute() method and see that the component does not get injected and the variable is null instead.

If you need an example plugin you can use the [Confluence Enterprise Hosted Migrator|https://bitbucket.org/vchoy/jira-migrator] and use the confluence-migrator branch.

The core problem seems to be that the autowiring is failing for the Webwork action for certain methods. I am not certain why. I enlisted [~fakraemer]'s help on this issue and he said "i can see the correct config being registered in com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.XWorkModuleDescriptor.addAction(Element, PackageConfig) but for some reason it's not loaded when the action is created". Which we both think is likely to be a bug.

In short, this issue makes everything that is not the execute() action unuseable for standard development.

I have attatched two images of me performing a single step in the debugger if you need proof that the autowiring is not being run and there is a problem.
fields.summary: Webwork action does not get plugin components injected

More importantly significant data, such as warning messages, and security settings, is stored in these settings.  Sometimes the loss is not even apparent for some time.

This condition should really raise an application level failure condition to be investigated by system administration.

h5. Scenario
When a user likes your page/comment, you'll get an email notification. In the notification, there's a link to 'Manage Notifications':
!manage notification.jpg!

Clicking on 'Manage Notifications', you'll be directed to Likes Notification Preferences:
!view notification.jpg!


h5. Improvement that can be made
Likes Notification Preferences (http://<confluence-url>/plugins/likes/view-notifications.action) should be incorporated into Email Settings (http://<confluence-url>/users/viewmyemailsettings.action). It'd be more convenient to have a single place to track such settings.

Therefore, when clicking on 'Manage Notifications', user should be redirected to http://<confluence-url>/users/viewmyemailsettings.action to manage the settings/preferences.
fields.summary: Incorporating Likes Notification Preferences into Email Settings

Selecting the text within a table, then change the cells color, but *not* deselect the text and press save, causes the Table to revert to white.

If you deselect the table after changing the colors, it is correctly saved, but not if the text remains selected.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a table and fill it with some text and save it
# Edit the page and select the text
# Click on the cell color button, and select a different color
# Do not deselect the text, hit save right away

Expected result:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27613].
  {panel}

This is a performance improvement to rendering decorators, occassionally the session stops being read-only and we end up with numerous jdbc commits, this is especially expensive in a clustered environment when the commits also cause coherence chatter.

Essentially there was a section of code in the header that was not wrapped in our usual transaction wrapper, which holds off on all db commits until the end of the transaction. A combination of this, clustering, the session not being read-only, and potentially some db latency cause a large series of jdbc commits which cause the delay. The fix is to wrap the code in the transaction wrapper, which stops the multiple commits.

h3. Patch
There is a patch available for Confluence 4.2.13. If you are unable to upgrade to 4.3.6 and you are on 4.2.13, you can apply this patch. Please do not apply it to any other versions however.

# Try this in a test system first to ensure it resolves your problem and does not cause any unforseen changes.
# Download the two attached files. 
# Remove the "-4.2.13" from the class files before copying them to the directory.
# Follow the [patch installation instructions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Patched+Class+Files]
# The subdirectory for the class files is {{<confluence-installation-directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/util/profiling}}. If any of these directories don't exist, you will need to create them.
fields.summary: Render decorator within a transaction to avoid unnecessary  JDBC commits
